ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Question 4: The final exam was the day after thanksgiving break which was a bit harsh considering it took away from family time having to study for it. With that said, it was nice to get it out of the way before other finals.

Michelle Bell is extremely competent, it's great to hear from a real scientist at the forefront of what she does about the challenges and nuances of study design and large research projects in general.
Declined to answer Question 5 for lack of a proper sample size.
Michele's knowledge of the material and the knowledgeable guest lecturers.
Very interesting lectures, by the professor and by guest speakers.Great opportunity to learn how to critique journal articles.Unique paper topic regarding an environmental disaster.
The lecturers by both Dr. Bell and guests. The course ran smoothly and covered a wide range of topics. I really enjoyed this course.
Reading all of the journal articles provides a very clear training in reading articles analytically. That was very useful.
The case studies and certain guest speakers.
Links to applications - policy etc.

Michelle Bell! She is literally the only person I've ever met who both appears to have substantial moral purpose to her life work AND correctly understands the importance of objectivity in the search for truth.Stop and read that again, it's serious.As a result she has a tremendous amount of my respect, and is also uniquely able to teach environmental health the way it should be taught. Also people like her should run the world.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: More continuity within the course and less focus on air quality.
Three hours seemed a bit long, but the discussion format and the break time in the middle helped a lot with this.
The response papers felt a bit like busy work.

Too much analyzing scientific articles and discussion based around these papers. Discussions could be based more around case studies and "what you would do and why?" rather than "what are the strengths and weaknesses of this article."

Amity Doolitle. Everything that is right about Michelle Bell is wrong about Amity Doolittle. She is just so biased, ideologized, and unscientific. Professor Bell should really just give the EJ lecture next time. Professor Bell's comments at the end Professor Doolittle's lecture were the only parts of that lecture that were worth noting down.The other guest lecturers were pretty solid, but it would be worthwhile I think for Professor Bell to exert some amount of additional control and coordination over the content of those lectures...there were a few weeks that seemed to be stepping on each other's toes--zoonotic diseases and vector-borne diseases and occupational health all ended up overlapping a bit more than I think they needed to.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Both were extremely available and responsive.
Excellent.
The availability and the quality of help provided by Dr. Bell and the Mercedes were top-notch!
The TA was great-- she was always helpful and offered informative insight to homework, projects, etc.
Better through email for both.
Didn't ask for any particular help.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: Although a non-Forestry student, I found this course to fit very well with my program (Public Health). I would recommend it to other students in my program.
It was an elective and I have an interest in public health with the environment.

I'm an undergrad Environmental Engineering major and this is an elective for that major. In fact at this point in my life I'm more interested in environmental health and environmental policymaking than I am in environmental engineering, so I guess it's good I ended up in this class.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I am interested in environmental risk factors to human health and wanted to study this from a perspective other than the School of Public Health (i.e. more environmental than epidemiology).
To receive a broad introduction in how the environment influences human health.
I am interested in public health and disasters and thought this course would be a good overview.
See Question 15.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: yes
Yes! Quite a thorough introduction to a variety of environmental health issues, along with good exposure to key scientific papers from the field, and public speaking practice.
Yes- the course, and Dr. Bell, were exceptional.
Yes and no- it was great going through so many different case studies, but I almost wish that we had spent more time analyzing one or two particular cases.
Not exactly. I would have liked more case studies and less of how to critique scientific papers.
Yes!

I'd say so. I learned a fair amount about the general art/science of investigating environmental health and making the kind of careful conclusions that matter for environmental policy. By and large it was well-taught, interesting, and relevant.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: yes
Yes.
Yes.
See question 17.
I swear I just answered this question.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: It was good to have one week where you were really forced to analyze the journal articles, but one presentation would have been sufficient.
a great experience, get new ideas and learned from each other. We coordinated well so I didnt find disadvantages
Group work was great, and added to the overall learning experience.
I liked working in a group and wish there was more of this for a final project rather than a final exam.
Helpful to bring different perspectives to bear on the studies we evaluated together, but an unprepared group member could also drag down your grade.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: You get out of it what you put into it.
Study so very hard for the final.
